Reviews.Title: “Appalling reception service!!!”
Reviews.Author: Munmun_Loo
Reviews.Content: The visit on 28th March 2012 to this hotel was unfortunately a horrible experiece. I am certain that once you are aware of what transpired, you will be as appalled as I am. Here's what happened: We are a group of 8 locals planning to visit our relatives from Guangzhou, China who happened to be in Singapore for holiday. As soon as we reached the hotel lobby, we request this male, skinny, wearing specs and a white long sleeve shirt at the stationed at the recept counter to help call of our relative in room 315. The immediate response from him was unfriendly and hostile attitude, demanding whether our relative was a male or a female. Nevertheless, we continued to provide the necessary information even with such attitude as we are looking forward to see our relatives (which occupies three rooms) Soon after, my relative came down to the hotel lobby and wanted to bring us up to their hotel rooms for some catch up. However, we were stopped by the same rude, unfriendly, hostile, male counter staff, again with the uncalled-for attitude demanding that he cannot allow so many of us up to the room, and only one of us is allowed. Please note that we've made it clear to him that we just want to have some catching up session and will leave in a short while and we are NOT staying for the night. Luckily, at the same instance, another male staff, dressed in long sleeve purple shirt behind this rude and unfriendly counter staff comply to our request. Upon leaving the hotel, within half an hour, the same rude, unfriendly and hostile male counter staff glared at us all the way till we went out of the hotel lobby. The whole incident totally ruined our happy and excited mood being able to catch up with our relatives. Such rude, hostile and unfriendly attitude from any service industry staff is totally unacceptable, especially so for a hotel staff, where it not only reflect badly on the hotel as well as the country! This bad incident had really left a very bad inpression on all of us as well as our relatives. As you can imagine, the experience fell far short of our expectations -- considering the friendly image which the hotel protrayed. I am not certain at this time if I will ever feel comfortable returning to the establishment.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely, horrible receptionist”
Reviews.Author: lizzieL
Reviews.Content: Just came back from visiting my relative from Guangzhou, who was a room guest at hotel 81 palace. the service at the reception was absolutely terrible! we had requested reception to call our relative in a particular and was met with absolutely hostile and condescending questions, such as name, exact part of China that my relative was from, gender and so on. Reception staff also tried to restrict the number of visiting guests from going to the hotel room and demanded for our IDs, which we refused to be bullied into giving. Upon exit of the hotel after 30 mins, the same rude and hostile reception staff glared and stared at us. This awful,sub standard service left a terrible impression on our Chinese relative and ourselves, local Singaporeans.I am ashamed to see such terrible service of our own country.Even for a budget hotel, such sub standard, slipshod level of service in unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Small but good value”
Reviews.Author: Noddy3102
Reviews.Content: Initially we were given a "box" without windows on the top floor. It should have been quiet - but the air conditioning plant on the roof above was seriously noisy. We asked to shift and with sincere apologies and no fuss were given a similar sized room on the 5th floor with window and much quieter! Yes there did seem to be some short term rental going on in the hotel, consistent with the neighbourhood, but it wasn't an issue. If you want a cheap place to sleep this is worth considering.

Reviews.Title: “Regret to book this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: roswin
Reviews.Content: As usual before any trip i will read review of any hotel..but this hotel i just thought not bad . at first i reach the hotel, not very good service from the receptionist..not even a smile from them.so arrogant.Than 2nd the room damn small..don even have a cupboard to put our things..some more we have one kid,,oh the place mess with our things since no cupboards...and the this hotel only have double beds..so family realy not adviseble to book this hotel..i guess this hotel suite for a single traveler..and this is red light area..full of prostitues around the hotel waithing for the customer...we just ignore and not our business.the room smell full of smoke..even outside the room all smelly...i really won,t recomend this hotel even though its cheap but not worthied..u still can get cheap hotel with better service in singapore.of course the plus point is near bus stop just 2 -3 min walk and u can go anywhere..we travel mostly thru the bus compare MRT which bit far to walk..almost 10 -12 mins walk to aljunied mrt..so if u come to geylang bus is the easiest and convinent..we went to sentosa take bus to harbourfront..many bus passes there.One more available the tea coffee,TV , hair dryer and room cleaning..but the cups is still with coffee and not cleans up..anyway if u ask me im not going to come back here again..really regret.

Reviews.Title: “Awful service!”
Reviews.Author: SP89
Reviews.Content: The service in this hotel is appalling! My boyfriend and I spent 1 night, in which time we managed to misplace a jacket in the room. After several phone calls and emails trying to retrieve said jacket we were finally told that it had been given away! Not only did the manager refuse to post it to us after I had committed to paying all postage costs but he denied contact (which was via email!). Do your self a favor and don't stay in a place where the manager and his staff do not care.

Reviews.Title: “Medium budget good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Prakash95
Reviews.Content: Located near Aljunied MRT station, this is good medium budget hotel. You can connect to any part of Singapore easily. Tea, coffee can be prepared in the room, and nearby there are so many super markets and restaurants. Traditional food can be found in this area, spice lovers can get crab chilly! The staffs were very helpful, I arrived early morning and put my luggage at reception without any fear, sililarly while leaving my flight was late, so I put my luggage there for few hours after checking out. Note: This hotel does not provide city tour operations but staff can help you from where to get it.

Reviews.Title: “budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tobias_C_S
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in Geylang approx. 10 minutes away from MRT. Geylang is known as redlight district but don't worry if you don't know you will not even notice. Romm is small but with Aircon and clean. Instant coffee or tea is available in the room. Staff is friendly. After checkout it was no problem to store luggage till early evening. So i have had time to spend last hours in Singapore w/o luggage till i have to go to airport. hotel is OK if you prefer to spend your money otherwise than on accomodation and only for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but very small and basic”
Reviews.Author: merryweather29
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few hours rest the Fri of the Grand prix weekend when prices where high and everywhere was booked. The room and ensuite were very small but functional and clean. The bed very OK and the sheets clean but uncomfortable sliding around on a plastic mattress. It is in a red light area but that did not cause any problems and we felt completely safe. Our room had no window and a full wall mirror (make of that what you will). For a one night pit stop it was just about OK but I wouldn't have coped any longer as there was no where to unpack or even put a suitcase. The main noise problem was from cleaners who obviously work 24 hrs sevicing rooms. The staff were friendly and poilte.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but in need of upgrade.”
Reviews.Author: Tiger L
Reviews.Content: Good location and free wi fi was an nice extra. Worn rooms and average showers. Price was well within our budget and we still felt safe at night. There are many cheap eateries on the door step of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Must be the worst hotel on the planet........stay away......you have been warned!!”
Reviews.Author: wahan
Reviews.Content: I arrived at this hotel/brothel late evening after it being recommended by a trust worthy company. If only they knew how disgusting this hotel actually is they would not send any of their clients back there and I have now informed them. The rooms are dirty, hair on the floor, pubic hair in the shower or their desription of a shower. There was no shower curtain the taps were rusty and the toilet was still dirty from a previous guest/prostitute. I didnt go back to the hotel until I was asked to leave the bar where I was drinking as it was closing and would have preferred to sleep on the street. I actually put my earphones in and listened to my i-pod until my taxi picked me up to ferry me to the airport. This at least took away some of the unpleasant sounds that the prostitutes who were working above below and either side of me were making. I could go on for hours but do not want waste any more time on the place.

Reviews.Title: “It was worth it”
Reviews.Author: Patty V
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last Aug 19-22. I really appreciate that it was a clean hotel. We were provided with 2 sachets of coffee mix and 1 bottled water. We had a good night sleep on the bed. NO noise. However, the smell in the elevator and along the corridor is a little off, though not that big deal. The receptionists in the entrance area are courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Guest Services”
Reviews.Author: JASCasadeOro
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with my two (2) boys, ages 14 and 10 - with unpredictable stay over : 1. No Ice Machine available for the guests. 2. When we're return at 18:00 hours our room was not made up - still the same condition when we left in the morning, had to call the front desk staff to have the housekeeper to bring us fresh towels and linen. No Excused, period. 3. Bed room and shower are very small, barely enough space to move around. 4. No two (2) queen size or full size bed, choices are one (1) queen or two (2) twin size beds but it was very comfortable and clean. 5. If you're traveling with a family of four (2+2) this is room definitely too small and this is a place/areas that kids should not know - not advisable to bring children as the hotel surrounding not appropriate for family. 6. Hotel management need to retrain the front desk staff and housekeeping department in regard to how to treat their guests in the Hospitality Industry, very poor. 7. Wall are a not that well isolated so it's a bit noisy. 8. This is a budget hotel and in my opinion "you got what your pay for".

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location and close to public transport, good value for budget traveling and very close to so many local eating places”
Reviews.Author: Christianna
Reviews.Content: Even if the cab drivers say the location is "not good", its definitely convenient if you need a place near the Expo or Changi Airport. It's 1min from Geylang Rd and eating places are all over. Nearby is a 7-11, a 24 hr grocery and Internet shop. The Shell gas station is no longer at the corner (Google maps need updating). The room (Unit 7-06) is a bit cramped for storage, traveling solo works but fits 2 at a pinch. The TV works with a few stations but has no remote control! Shower is ensuite but has no curtain so expect a bit of splashing around. Hot and cold water works perfectly. Room has basic coffee - tea maker, hair dryer, two towels and minimal toiletries. Airconditioning got too cold past 1am but I survived by turning it off thru the night. Free wifi available! Just needs you to request for a new account+ password every 24hrs, and everytime the signal drops you need to log in again. Everyday the room and bed is tidied up, but the floor isn't swept clean. Occasionally I noticed the lift had a slight durian smell inside, but after I commented to the front desk it seemingly disappeared. They offer free taxi-calling service, which is a big help. Be sure to bring your own umbrella esp if you plan to take the MRT daily (nearest: Aljunied Station, 8-min walk from Hotel 81). If you plan on exploring Geylang and nearby areas for food and adventure, consider Hotel 81 - Palace or Hotel 81 - Geylang.

Reviews.Title: “very basic”
Reviews.Author: hdox
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights while waiting to catch a cruise. Rooms are very small. This is budget accommodation - not a place to impress your girlfriend.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and great value”
Reviews.Author: leanne_gray
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. Room small but clean and had wall mounted LCD TV with Sky connection. Free WiFi in room. Small bathroom but clean towels provided with toiletries (including toothbrush!). Location good for MRT (5 minutes walk) and great food stalls in area. Although supposed to be Singapore Red Light District we saw little of this and area seemed safe enough. Overall, great value for clean room. Would book again, especially considering prices of other Singapore hotels. TIP: If not happy with your room, tell staff and I'm sure they would switch rooms. From reading other reviews on Trip Advisor, room standards seem to vary.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for a stopover”
Reviews.Author: laendersammler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel 81 palace for a one night stopover in September 2010. It is located a short walk to the metro. Room was small, but clean, quiet and functional. And that is all I need for a stopover. Near the hotel are a lot of chinese food stalls. I would book the Hotel 81 Palace again, if I be in Singapore again.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy little hotel in real Singapore neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: fillupt
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here, and had a good stay. It is a short walk to two different MRT stations, which take you directly to the middle of town, and back to the airport. The room was very small, and windowless, but had a decent heat pump and shower, but no fridge. The desk staff were friendly and helpful, and present 24 hours. The area is in the red-light district, but we always felt safe, and enjoyed mingling with the locals and eating in the road side eateries where there often isn't a word of English spoken. It is so easy to get around on the MRT that the location was a highlight of the trip!

Reviews.Title: “For Singapore good price.”
Reviews.Author: Alfred06
Reviews.Content: The location is lively in the middle of Singapores nightlife and red light district. Walking distance to Sky train-Subway. Rooms extremly small, cold-warm water mix had to be fixed. Aircon could not be regulated, not even turned on or off. Temperature went down to 22 C. I complained and they brought me blankets. Laughable. I opened the small window to get no could. So next day they made the window unopenable! They needed two days to bring the aircon running to 25-26 C. I still could not regulate it or turn it off. Off only when you broke the electric circuit in taking the key out of the electric key box. And no refrigerator and if you come with big luggage, no space for that in the room. But I would come back, as other Hotels are just to expensive in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel at a low price with great service and facilities”
Reviews.Author: kenghuei
Reviews.Content: Decided to book this hotel for my parents for a night as they are coming down for some official stuffs and wanted a very budget place just to stay comfortably. Checked online that this is one of the cheapest Hotel 81 in S'pore... was expecting less but surprisingly, rooms are clean and comfortable albeit small and service at the reception is very good! I requested for internet from the receptionist.. they do not have wifi but only broadband at some rooms in Level 5 (Member's Floor), she allowed us to change to a room at Level 5 though we have already used the room and bathroom. My other questions and requests are entertained very well too. Location is very convenient to good eateries and there is direct bus to Golden Mile bus terminal and many buses to other parts of S'pore. Buzzing and very crowded red-light district at night...but no concerns as our personal space and privacy is not intruded, yet the streets are relatively safe. Recommended if you are just looking for a budget, comfortable and convenient place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms, lifts and hallways reek of cigarettes even in non-smoking levels.”
Reviews.Author: ciaobella_bambina
Reviews.Content: I had one of the worst night sleep here! Too many prostitutes coming in and out of the hotel. Reception staff efficient and friendly. But the stench of cigarettes everywhere was so strong that I wanted to gag. The pillow cases were like plastic and very unconfortable. Rooms were dated and tiny. Such a creepy hotel. Try somewhere else with proper sheets and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed one night.. good for transit but no more”
Reviews.Author: ginom4334
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night and found the rooms to be very small and basic. Front desk staff not very friendly and needed to be pushed for any information. The only good thing was the rate. Will stay again for transit but not for holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money, but very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: SF49erFan8
Reviews.Content: Found the $50 daily rate attractive considering the high expense in Singapore. The rooms are very cramped and minimalistic, but expected at this price point. The front desk staff were not very helpful. However, the cleaning staff were always friendly and helpful. Only 10 minute walk to Aljunied MRT station. Plenty of good food stalls in the Geylang area at great prices.

Reviews.Title: “not too bad considering the price”
Reviews.Author: neilsolaris
Reviews.Content: We found that this hotel was quite nice, but nothing special. The staff were quite lack lustre, and not particularly adept when it comes to customer service. I didn't really find them rude though, just slightly indifferent. My main complaint with our room is that it smelt of cigarette smoke. Otherwise it was ok. When I went to check-out I asked them where the toilet was, and they told me they don't have one! I find this quite unusual for a hotel. I quite liked the area. There are plenty of restaurants, and because it is away from the tourist areas they are quite cheap and good quality. It is conveniently located not too far from the train line, with good access to the airport. The fact it is in the red light district did not bother me. It didn't seem particularly seedy unlike other red light district hotels I have inadvertently booked in the past!

Reviews.Title: “perfect place if you're on a budget”
Reviews.Author: september3ph
Reviews.Content: In an expensive city like Singapore one could only wish to find accommodations that is just right for the traveling backpacker. I took the subway to this hotel and it is on the same line as the airport so very convenient, the nearest station is aljunied and is only 10 minutes away. I was expecting less with what I paid for and to my surprise, the room I had was very nice, I had a comfortable queen sized bed, private bath and cable (the flat screen tv was just icing on the cake). The only thing I wish I had was a closet but if you're on a budget, a closet should be the last thing you'd look for. I got to the hotel at around 10:30am and the friendly staff, gave me a room anyway even though check in should be at 2:00pm. I would gladly stay here again if I do get a chance to go back, Keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “Average but Cheap”
Reviews.Author: OutthereWollongong
Reviews.Content: This hotel was Ok for a stop over however the plastic sheet on bed was very uncomfortable however close to MRT & other transport singapore is a very clean City. The Zoo is amazing

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but good value”
Reviews.Author: Tooheys_New
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice in October 2010 and would stay there gain. This hotel has the location for business and pleasure (night life). Standard rooms are small but adequate and good value for the price in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Fit for budget conscious travelers avoiding hostels”
Reviews.Author: lakbay_easy_online
Reviews.Content: Hotel 81 Palace Singapore is a tourist-class budget hotel located at 25 Lorong 16 (16th Street), Geylang Road, Geylang District in Singapore. We really took a risk in booking this hotel since there were no pictures available through TripAdvisor. Arriving at the hotel, we were welcomed by the front desk. They were okay, they were not really that much warm and welcoming but just okay. It was the fastest hotel check-in ever. No questions asked, we were swiftly whisked with the hotel key and off we go to room 603, a double bed. We weren't even charged a deposit which on the room rates board, said $20 SGD. The hotel is just right not, really big comparing it to the major hotels in Singapore. It is right in front of another Hotel 81 which is Hotel 81 Geylang. It is I think 8 stories high. There are 2 elevators connecting you from the lobby to the rooms upstairs. The corridor to the rooms are well lit, quiet and clean. We didn't meet any Geylang Girls with an uncle with them if you know what I mean. However, there is a peculiar strong bleachy smell along the corridors probably it's the bleach they use to clean the rooms. When we entered the room, we were surprised to see it okay, clean and comfy. Although small, it was cozy. You can see on the pics I posted it was well lit, has a wall mounted TV which has about 8-10 channels some are in Bahasa Malaysia, some are in English. No CNN, no ESPN but there is an HBO however which we didn't really watch. Beside the door is the bathroom which was just okay as well. It looked clean however it smelled cigarette smoke. We really disliked the smell because we were not smokers. We kept the exhaust on for a couple of minutes, splashed cologne and thankfully, the smell went away. The shower has hot and cold which worked fine. Has a big roll of tissue that never seemed to empty. There is a hair and body lotion (soap and shampoo in one) dispenser which also never seem to run out, a supply of a comb, 2 toothbrushes with some sort of dried up toothpaste packaged with it just in case you forgot your toothpaste, I tried it felt like using baking soda for brushing, a shower cap and a sanitary bag. The toilet bowl was clean and flushes well. There is a huge wall mounted mirror over a clean sink. The whole bathroom gets wet when you shower but dries up after a few hours, the door shuts close and the floor outside doesn't get wet just to let you know. Beside the bed was another mirror over a table which has a box of tissue a hair dryer and a 220 AC plug for charging. There is only 1 available plug for you to charge anything with a 2 pronged plug so if you need to plug in more, you need to bring your own extension. This was a problem to us since we had 2 cameras that needed charging. We tried to unplug the TV and had a hard time plugging it back, the water heater and the blower though has 3 prongs. The vanity had a small ottoman for sitting and beside it was a small table with a small drawer for stowing other items. On the table was a tray with a water kettle, 2 mugs, 2 coffee stirrers, 1 3-in-1 coffee, 1 3-in-1 tea, and two bottles of water. Now the bed. The bed is mattress type but the foam was covered in faux leather/synthetic linoleum, the like that covers a leatherette sofa for some reason. There is a layer of heavy bottom sheet made of heavy combed cotton, then a layer of cotton linen and another one as a top sheet. Now here's one thing I found interesting. There are 2 pillows which had a disturbing cover. It had disposable covers. I hated the disposable covers cause i thought they were not absorbent. You can see on my pictures. I just can't describe the material but in our country, we use them to wrap gifts. So i removed them, i brought with me a pillow case which i used to wrapped the pillows. The pillow covers however worked great to put used clothes in. So that's a WARNING. I'm not sure with the other Hotel 81s but I think that's how they eliminate washing of the linen covers. Air-Conditioning Temperature can be controlled from a wall panel, though it's hot in Singapore, we turned it to the lowest setting at night since it's very cool for us. TV There is no remote control for some reason so you have to get up and manually press the buttons. Cleanliness The room sad to say is not spotlessly clean. I was just a little concerned over some hairs over the bathroom drain. There were a few strands of hair as well over the bed after we removed the covers. There are some spots in the room which had some black spots, hoping it's not mold. It's found near the opening of the aircon, the lower part of the canvas and the frame of the painting in front of the wall of the bed and something i discovered at the back of the thick curtains. In my opinion, i don't think the curtains are washed regularly for the black spotted stains to remain on it. The next morning, we saw an auntie (the housekeeping woman) outside the room so we asked her personally to clean our room. She was kind but when we came back, we were surprised though the room was made up, the cups we used weren't cleaned. They were just washed on the faucet but never cleaned thoroughly. They were also inconsistent with replacing the complimentary stuff sometimes we get just one water, or just 1 pair of the sachet drinks etc. Check-out was also a breeze. When using the phone to call locally, call the front desk first to inform them and they will charge you SGD$1 for unlimited local calls for 24 hours. Not sure how much for international calls. We had left a package of clothes for a friend to pick up at the front desk and they were willing to accept it for pick up. We also got the packaged our friend left at the front desk. ALSO to avoid the hassle, never ever ever lock the door from the inside when you're leaving the room. We were not told that the doors cannot be turned from the outside and can only be opened with a key. If you lock it from the inside, you will not be able to open it with a key. So just pull the door close when leaving and it shuts automatically. From the Changi Budget Terminal, take a free shuttle bus that will take you to T2 connecting you to the city by MRT which costs somewhere around $1.60 SGD (plus refundable $1 card deposit). We figured that the nearest MRT Station to Hotel 81 Palace is Aljunied Station at the East-West Green Line. We thought finding the hotel was easy because the streets had large signs and ordered numerically (Lorong 20,19,18,17,16). From the station it was probably 10-15 minutes walk and arriving at noon, the heat was unbearable. Booking this hotel through Agoda, we had some apprehensions since it is located in the so called Red Light District but to our surprise, we didn't see much Geylang Girls around. Probably one or two but generally, the location is safe at night. The place really lights up at night. The area had corners and corners of food shops, and hawker centers (one right across Lor 16 was G City Food Court which is a cleaner, more comfortable and okay place to eat specially at night since it is air-conditioned as opposed to the food stores around. You can order char kway teow or stir fried flat noodles with pork, Singapore chicken rice, a variety of noodles, hot pot, clay pot etc.). The area also has lots of fruit stands at night and for very affordable costs you can try durian and dragon fruit just for the adventure but don't forget to buy lansones, the small yellow-brown teardrop fruit clusters which are very very sweet and fleshy as well as other fruits like peach, apple, oranges, pear and other local fruits that are really fresh. When looking for the hotel, try to locate the Shell Gas Station along Geylang Road, and to the right of it is Lorong 16. When going to Vivo City, where Sentosa Express' Station Harbourfrount Station is located, just go to the bus stop located near the Shell Gas Station, take bus 80 for a fare of i believe less than $3SGD and it will take you to Vivo City Mall. There is also Bus 2 which will take you to Little India. Also a bus that will take you along North Bridge Road to Clarke Quay. The bus stops are clearly marked with the service routes. Buses coming from the city however alight on Sims street which is the street opposite from Geylang Road. The closest of the bus stops is the one infront of the Xiu Fu FTY building (or something that sounds like that) because Lor 1 and Lor 23 bus stop are too far from the hotel. I believe I have done a thorough review. Overall, since this is one of the cheapest next to Happy Hotel, strongly recommended by Hotel 81 website, I liked the hotel and will definitely stay here again because of value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value the hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlexMiten
Reviews.Content: Very very value hotel I've stayed. My room was very clean, good funiture. It's near the MRT, good location.Friendly staff. Recommend the hotel to my friends definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel near SMRT Station and plenty Food Outlets.”
Reviews.Author: bizarre98
Reviews.Content: As been mentioned by many previous travellers, this is the place If you are looking for a clean budget hotel in Singapore. The location is near SMRT and on the Changi airport E-W lane. Plenty of F&B outlets around within 2-5 minutes of walk and stays open until late. Room is small with no cabinet but clean. Towel and bedspread change daily.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel, Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Man0j
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a budget hotel in Singapore, you can't go wrong with Hotel 81 - Palace. Pros: Clean, Hygienic, Close to the Al-Juneid MRT, Close to good food joints Cons: Small Rooms, In Geylang, Avoid if going with family

Reviews.Title: “For the price you pay, this is the best place to be..”
Reviews.Author: TharakaM
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my wife from 29 May to 31 May 2010. The room was samll. But very clean and nicely arranged. There is a girl in the reception (unfortunately I forgot her name) who is very helpful and friendly. It seems like she handles everything. If you tell her what you want, you get it immediately. Although the hotel is located in Red Light District, it's safer to walk around even during midnight. We atayed there for 3 days and there is niothing to complain. For the price this is the best choice. You get plenty of food oulets around the hotel. Just 10minutes walk to the Aljuneid MRT Station. And another 15-20 minutes to the shopping areas. I will definitely stay in the hotel on my nest visit to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible!”
Reviews.Author: J4nice
Reviews.Content: i was on a holiday with my school group and 3 people that is in 1 room.. it is very small and no place to put our luggage!!and the whole hotelfloor is made or tiles when ppl walk it makes noise so i cant really sleep the blanket was dirty! it was so dirty!!!when i cover my leg its very itchy! like there was mosqitoes in it! then in the second day, it was raining the at night the room417 was leaking and it was room after the room service on the morning at night when mwe and my friends came back to the hotel my friends luggage cant be opened!! the before the day, her luggage was still working! i think it was the maid the serviced our room the cant open it and she called hack to her house in malaysia that waster her RM17 she was so angry and upset! then she pulled the whole lock out then her luggage was spoiled!! this was the worse hotel i've ever stayed in!! and there was not enough plug so i cant charge my phones camera and my mp3 only 1 plug! and the other 1 is for the kettle and the kettle is so dirty i dont even wanna try to use it!!...i think its a no star hotel!!! and dont even ask me about the toileet it was so small i have no place to put my clothes and on the wall, the tiles have scary faces !! and i have to take bath in front of the mirror! siao! there's many more bad things about this hotel!! i suggest you not to stay there i onli enjoy the city of singpore it was so green n clean n so high tech i so miss singpore now that i am at malaysia...i hope that this hotel can improve.. but if dun improve also never mind cuz im not gonna go back there already...

Reviews.Title: “If this is all you can afford. Save a little longer!”
Reviews.Author: Aussieinmalaysia
Reviews.Content: If you are coming for a holiday to Singapore, please do yourself a favour and not stay at this hotel! This may be a little harsh, if your your the type of traveller used to staying in back packer style accom. But if your the back packer type you might find this hotel suitable. I came to Singapore for a business trip, and decided that being reasonably priced and the pictures on the internet looking ok decided to book . When you get to the checkin counter its not to bad.The first annoying thing was full pre payment of the 4 nights stay.... THAT WAS THE BIGGEST MISTAKE!!! The rooms are smelly and very old. The hall way out side the rooms are tiled meaning you can hear the workers going into the guests rooms all night. I think you can guess whats happening at this hotel! The other thing is all the electrical wire hanging out of the hall way roof is not that safe. If your the sort of person that has the attitude "Its just a place to sleep at night. Who cares" then this is the place for you. But if you want to feel safe at night and comfortable. Maybe this is not suitable. The best part about my stay here was when i checked out. I should not sound so negative though. The location was good and Singapore is a beautiful city. Come see Singapore. If you can only afford to stay here when you come to Singapore, maybe you need to work and save for a few more weeks before coming.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Sign - "Rates by the Hour"”
Reviews.Author: drewby78
Reviews.Content: The previous poster was accurate in his/her description of the property. However, I belive they were a big generous with the two stars and I will explain why I feel this way. First, a hotel situated in the redlight district is not inherently bad. It adds a little bit excitement to the trip and at no time did I feel in danger. I was solicited by a prostitute while walking with my girlfriend, which was forward, but not offensive. However, my girlfriend did notice that the Hotel rented rooms by the hour and two hour. I can only come up with one reason why that would be the case in the middle of a redlight district. You can come to your own conclusions. We also awoke to the sound of "business" being done one morning and heard the clop of high heels in the hallways several times late at night. Again, I have no moral problem with this type of activity, however, for hygenic reasons I do not like the though of "business" being practiced in my hotel and (perish the thought) in the bed I was sleeping in that night. I can not recommend this hotel, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “An adequate budget hotel in a bad neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: maynard7
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the "red light" district of Geylang, and there are many prostitutes in the area after dark, both real women and transvestites. If you are a single man (especially a foreigner) walking alone at night, you will be constantly hounded by them. If that's what you're looking for, then look no further. Nearly every hotel in the Geylang area has this same problem because of the neighborhood. If you're the type that has dinner and goes to your room by 9:00 p.m., all this might not bother you. The hotel itself isn't really that bad, however, it was designed and built not as a place to stay for a few days, but as a place to stay for a few hours. There is no closet or clothes hangers, just 4 hooks on the wall. You will literally live out of your suitcase, since there is not much room to put anything. The bathroom is about 5 feet by 5 feet, and the entire room becomes a shower stall, as there is no separate shower or bathtub. Everything gets wet in the bathroom when you shower. The bed has a water-proof mattress pad which I found uncomfortable as my skin couldn't breathe. The disposable pillow cases are not made of fabric, but of a synthetic tightly woven mesh material. (The sign in the lobby says that for hygenic reasons, they have "upgraded" to this type of pillowcase. What's next, the sheets too? I spent the night tossing and turning. The TV had several channels in English. The room was very quiet as I had specifically asked for a quiet room and I got number 532 at the end of the hall. There are blackout curtains which kept the room dark when closed. The central air conditioning was quiet and worked well. The front desk staff was friendly. The price of 49 Singapore dollars was good, but if that's all you can afford, I strongly advise you to save more money and come to Singapore when you can afford a hotel in a better neighborhood.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel 81 - Palace
HotelInfo.Address: 25 Lorong 16 Geylang, Singapore 398867, Singapore
